title: Quantum Teleportation Experiment
description: Demonstrates quantum teleportation by transferring an unknown quantum state from one photon to another using entanglement and classical communication.

parameters.description: Electronic unit that processes signals from all three detectors to identify valid teleportation events within a coincidence window
Classical communication channel that transmits Bell measurement results to control the unitary correction operations on the correction wave plates

physics_explanation: An unknown quantum state |ψ⟩ = α|H⟩ + β|V⟩ is prepared on photon A using the state preparation laser and wave plate. Simultaneously, entangled photons B and C are created via SPDC in the |Φ+⟩ = (|HH⟩ + |VV⟩)/√2 Bell state. A Bell state measurement on photons A and B at the polarizing beam splitter projects their joint state, which instantaneously transforms photon C into the original state |ψ⟩ up to a known Pauli operation. Classical communication of the Bell measurement outcome enables real-time correction of photon C using programmable wave plates, completing the faithful teleportation of the unknown quantum state.

component_justifications.State Preparation Laser: Creates photon A in a well-defined polarization state that will be transformed into the unknown state to be teleported
component_justifications.Initial Polarizer: Establishes a horizontal polarization reference state for subsequent manipulation
component_justifications.State Preparation QWP: Converts the horizontal state into an arbitrary superposition |ψ⟩ = α|H⟩ + β|V⟩ representing the unknown quantum state
component_justifications.Entanglement Pump Laser: 405nm pump laser provides the energy for SPDC to generate the entangled photon pair B and C
component_justifications.Entanglement BBO Crystal: Type-II SPDC source creating maximally entangled Bell state |Φ+⟩ = (|HH⟩ + |VV⟩)/√2 between photons B and C
component_justifications.Idler Steering Mirror: Directs idler photon C toward the teleportation output path for final state analysis
component_justifications.Signal Steering Mirror: Directs signal photon B toward the Bell state measurement region
component_justifications.State Redirection Mirror: Redirects photon A from the state preparation path to interfere with photon B at the Bell state analyzer
component_justifications.BSA HWP: Half-wave plate that enables complete Bell state discrimination by rotating polarization basis before the PBS
component_justifications.Bell State Analyzer PBS: Polarizing beam splitter that performs the crucial Bell state measurement on photons A and B by separating H and V polarizations
component_justifications.BSA Detector H: SPAD detector measuring horizontally polarized photons from the Bell state analyzer
component_justifications.BSA Detector V: SPAD detector measuring vertically polarized photons, completing the Bell measurement to identify which Bell state was projected
component_justifications.Teleportation Mirror 1: Steers teleported photon C toward the correction optics for Pauli gate application
component_justifications.Teleportation Mirror 2: Final steering of photon C to align with the correction wave plates
component_justifications.Correction HWP: Programmable half-wave plate that applies σx or σz Pauli corrections based on Bell measurement outcome
component_justifications.Correction QWP: Programmable quarter-wave plate that applies σy Pauli correction when combined with HWP rotations
component_justifications.Analysis Polarizer: Analyzes the final polarization state of the corrected teleported photon to verify successful state transfer
component_justifications.Teleportation Detector: SPAD detector that measures the successfully teleported and corrected quantum state
component_justifications.3-Fold Coincidence Unit: Electronic system that identifies valid teleportation events by detecting three-fold coincidences between both Bell detectors and the teleportation detector
component_justifications.Classical Communication: Real-time communication system that transmits Bell measurement results to control the correction wave plate orientations within the coherence time

expected_outcome: Triple coincidence events between the Bell state detectors and teleportation detector will demonstrate quantum teleportation with fidelity exceeding the classical limit of 2/3. The correction operations ensure that regardless of which Bell state was measured, the teleported photon C faithfully reproduces the original unknown state |ψ⟩, confirming genuine quantum state transfer without classical information about the original state.
